comments.html: Question is: Which client operating systems support RFC6106. I know of Linux and BSD (if the right software is installed). Last time I checked Windows was not supported. Haven't checked my android tablet / phone recently.
comments.name: Jens Link

comments.html:
Hi Ivan,

On IOS, it is supported in T train since 15.4(1)T and S train (since 15.3(2)S).At least that's what was told to me from a Cisco employee 2 week ago. Haven't verified it myself

Cheers,
Christopher
comments.name: Christopher

comments.html: According to the sixth column on this page (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_IPv6_support_in_operating_systems), there are many client O/Ss with RDNSS support, which is great news.
comments.name: Unknown

comments.html: In this case, it was a bit different. RA was created before DHCPv4, and DNS was configured manually in those (pre-DHCP) days. It just took _way_ longer for IPv6 to get anything close to feature parity with IPv4.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
So I've been working with IPv6 for about 3 years now, and the one thing that comes to mind particularly in this case and others is that in creating IPv6, the various group representatives involved were more interested in getting their name on RFC papers by solving problems that had already been solved 30 years ago.

Is is just me or do we the so called "Internet Generation" of engineers lack the ability to recognise that if something is not broken, don't try and fix it. I know DHCPv4 was not perfect, but it is very well tested and battle hardened for use in the wider Internet. Sure there are some use cases that it has trouble meeting but at the end of the day wouldn't it be better trying to build on that then trying to re-invent things from scratch for the sake of a RFC recognition.
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: Now Android 5 is one reason more to support rfc-6106.
comments.name: Thomas Schäfer

comments.html: Let me ask about the support of RFC6106. I know Linux operation system is supported but can you please tell me about software right version to make it working ?
comments.name: Unknown
